lexUnit.name: omen.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an event regarded as a portent of good or evil.

sentence.text: The pundits agree that the omens for the royals are not good , the republicans are gaining ground .
All in all , as Reagan prepared to take office the omens for a successful presidency did not look particularly good .
The omens for the new state were not encouraging in the first months of its existence .
Their appearance in the sky was an omen of good fortune .
Sometimes thought to be the souls of unbaptised children and unrepentant sinners , their bloodcurdling howls were an omen of death to all who heard them .
It was , had we but realized it , an omen of things to come .
Her piercing cry is a death omen and she will hover near the person she is attempting to warn , crying ` My husband !
It is frequently seen in stormy weather off the Cape of Good Hope and considered an omen of ill fortune .
The omens for the future , she suggested , were none too good .
By the twenties , lace curtains and an aspidistra in the window were bad omens .
However , she is quite dolorous , and sighting her , or hearing her crying as she slowly shuffles by , are both very bad omens .
Such mishaps were bad omens , and though the townspeople maintained that they did not take the Wheel seriously they were happier when all went according to plan .
Their condemnation of the award is not a good omen .
Given that James is a keen Everton fan , however , the defeat of the rival Reds was a good omen .
They were known to be present in all good mines -- indeed their absence was not a good omen .
I told Michael Quirke how a heron had once nearly landed on my back in Wales , and he was mightily impressed , taking it as a good luck omen .
All three of the participants in that clandestine meeting , looking back a few months later , were to recall the weather on that day as an omen -- a mirror of the tempestuous events which followed .
Surely she had taken it as an ill omen ?
The switchboard answered quickly and it seemed like a good omen .
The name of the local pub , Live and Let Live , seemed like a good omen the first time she drove past it .
The mist seemed like a bad omen and Sara 's heart sank a little .
But the underdogs in this north London derby believe their third round victory over Bristol on Saturday , is the omen that can turn about their season .
